Calcium is an essential mineral that assists with many of the bodyâ€™s processes, such as maintaining 
cell membranes in nerve as well as muscle contraction ( 200). Low calcium intake is thought to 
cause high blood pressure by increasing the amount of calcium released in the cells of blood 
vessels, possibly leading to the constriction of these tissues. By supplementing with calcium 
during pregnancy, the amount of cellular calcium released is lessened, as is smooth muscle
